tool.name: AssayGeneratorMetabo
tool.description: Assay library generation from DDA data (Metabolomics)
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing #if $sirius_executable: mkdir sirius_executable && ln -s '$sirius_executable' 'sirius_executable/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $sirius_executable.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($sirius_executable.ext)' && #end if mkdir in_cond.in && #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" mkdir ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else ln -s '$in_cond.in' 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' && #end if mkdir in_id_cond.in_id && #if $in_id_cond.in_id_select == "no" mkdir ${' '.join(["'in_id_cond.in_id/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_id_cond.in_id) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_id_cond.in_id/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_id_cond.in_id) if f])} #else ln -s '$in_id_cond.in_id' 'in_id_cond.in_id/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_id_cond.in_id.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_id_cond.in_id.ext)' && #end if mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd #if $sirius_executable: -sirius_executable 'sirius_executable/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $sirius_executable.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($sirius_executable.ext)' #end if -in #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' #end if -in_id #if $in_id_cond.in_id_select == "no" ${' '.join(["'in_id_cond.in_id/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_id_cond.in_id) if f])} #else 'in_id_cond.in_id/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_id_cond.in_id.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_id_cond.in_id.ext)' #end if -out 'out/output.${out_type}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: The Sirius executable
param.help: Provide a full or relative path, or make sure it can be found in your PATH environment select txt data sets(s)

param.name: in_select
param.label: Run tool in batch mode for -in
param.option: Yes: process each dataset in an independent job

param.label: MzML input file(s) used for assay library generation
param.help: select mzml data sets(s)

param.label: MzML input file(s) used for assay library generation
param.help: select mzml data sets(s)

param.name: in_id_select
param.label: Run tool in batch mode for -in_id
param.option: Yes: process each dataset in an independent job

param.label: FeatureXML input file(s) containing identification information
param.help: (e.g. AccurateMassSearch) select featurexml data sets(s)

param.label: FeatureXML input file(s) containing identification information
param.help: (e.g. AccurateMassSearch) select featurexml data sets(s)

param.name: out_type
param.label: File type of output out (Assay library output file)
Fragment annotation method
Mz tolerance for the resolution of identification ambiguity over multiple files
RT tolerance in seconds for the resolution of identification ambiguity over multiple files
Filter compound based on total occurrence in analysed samples
Filters annotations based on the explained intensity of the peaks in a spectrum
Decoys will be generated using the fragmentation tree re-rooting approach
param.help: This option does only work in combination with the fragment annotation via Sirius

param.label: Uses different methods for decoy generation
param.help: Basis for the method is the fragmentation-tree re-rooting approach ('original'). This approach can be extended by using 'resolve_overlap', which will resolve overlapping fragments of the highest intensity fragments chosen, by adding -CH2 mass to the overlapping fragments. 'Add_shift' will add a -CH2 mass shift to the target fragments and use them as additional decoys if fragmentation-tree re-rooting failed. 'Both' combines the extended methods (resolve_overlap, add_shift)

param.label: Spectrum with the highest precursor intensity or a consensus spectrum is used for assay library construction (if no fragment annotation is used)
Use exact mass for precursor and fragment annotations
Excludes precursor in ms2 from transition list
Max m/z distance of the precursor entries of two spectra to be merged in [Da]
Tolerance window (left and right) for precursor selection [seconds], for consensus spectrum generation (only available without fragment annotation)
Use features without identification information
Minimal number of transitions
Maximal number of transitions
Threshold for cosine similarity of MS2 spectra from the same precursor used in consensus spectrum creation
Further transitions need at least x% of the maximum intensity (default 5%)

param.name: use_deisotoper
param.label: Use Deisotoper (if no fragment annotation is used)

param.name: fragment_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance used to match isotopic peaks

param.name: fragment_unit
param.label: Unit of the fragment tolerance

param.name: min_charge
param.label: The minimum charge considered

param.name: max_charge
param.label: The maximum charge considered

param.name: min_isopeaks
param.label: The minimum number of isotopic peaks (at least 2) required for an isotopic cluste

param.name: max_isopeaks
param.label: The maximum number of isotopic peaks (at least 2) considered for an isotopic cluste

param.name: keep_only_deisotoped
param.label: Only monoisotopic peaks of fragments with isotopic pattern are retained

param.name: annotate_charge
param.label: Annotate the charge to the peaks

param.name: filter_by_num_masstraces
param.label: Number of mass traces each feature has to have to be included
param.help: To use this parameter, setting the feature_only flag is necessary

param.name: precursor_mz_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance window for precursor selection (Feature selection in regard to the precursor)

param.name: precursor_mz_tolerance_unit
param.label: Unit of the precursor_mz_tolerance

param.name: precursor_rt_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance window (left and right) for precursor selection [seconds]

param.name: isotope_pattern_iterations
param.label: Number of iterations that should be performed to extract the C13 isotope pattern
param.help: If no peak is found (C13 distance) the function will abort. Be careful with noisy data - since this can lead to wrong isotope patterns

param.name: feature_only
param.label: Uses the feature information from in_featureinfo to reduce the search space to MS2 associated with a feature

param.name: no_masstrace_info_isotope_pattern
param.label: Use this flag if the masstrace information from a feature should be discarded and the isotope_pattern_iterations should be used instead

param.name: processors
param.label: Number of cpu cores to use
param.help: If not specified SIRIUS uses all available cores

param.name: ignore_formula
param.label: Ignore given molecular formula in internal .ms format, while processing

param.name: q
param.label: Suppress shell output

param.name: ppm_max
param.label: Maximum allowed mass deviation in ppm for decomposing masses [ppm]

param.name: ppm_max_ms2
param.label: Maximum allowed mass deviation in ppm for decomposing masses in MS2 [ppm].If not specified, the same value as for the MS1 is used

param.name: tree_timeout
param.label: Time out in seconds per fragmentation tree computations
param.help: 0 for an infinite amount of time

param.name: compound_timeout
param.label: Maximal computation time in seconds for a single compound
param.help: 0 for an infinite amount of time

param.name: no_recalibration
param.label: Disable recalibration of input spectra

param.name: profile
param.label: Name of the configuration profile

param.name: formula
param.label: Specify the neutral molecular formula of the measured compound to compute its tree or a list of candidate formulas the method should discriminate
param.help: Omit this option if you want to consider all possible molecular formulas

param.name: ions_enforced
param.label: The iontype/adduct of the MS/MS data
param.help: Example: [M+H]+, . [M-H]-, [M+Cl]-, [M+Na]+, [M]+. You can also provide a . comma separated list of adducts

param.name: candidates
param.label: The number of formula candidates in the SIRIUS output

param.name: candidates_per_ion
param.label: Minimum number of candidates in the output for each ionization
param.help: Set to force output of results for each possible ionization, even if not part of highest ranked results. -1 omits parameter in Sirius

param.name: elements_considered
param.label: Set the allowed elements for rare element detection
param.help: Write SBrClBSe to allow the elements S,Br,Cl,B and Se

param.name: elements_enforced
param.label: Enforce elements for molecular formula determination
param.help: Write CHNOPSCl to allow the elements C, H, N, O, P, S and Cl. Add numbers in brackets to restrict the minimal and maximal allowed occurrence of these elements: CHNOP[5]S[8]Cl[1-2]. When one number is given then it is interpreted as upper bound. Default is CHNOP

param.name: no_isotope_score
param.label: Disable isotope pattern score

param.name: no_isotope_filter
param.label: Disable molecular formula filte
param.help: When filtering is enabled, molecular formulas are excluded if their theoretical isotope pattern does not match the theoretical one, even if their MS/MS pattern has high score

param.name: ions_considered
param.label: the iontype/adduct of the MS/MS data
param.help: Example: [M+H]+, [M-H]-, [M+Cl]-, [M+Na]+, [M]+. You can also provide a comma separated list of adducts

param.name: db
param.label: Search formulas in the Union of the given databases db-name1,db-name2,db-name3
param.help: If no database is given all possible molecular formulas will be respected (no database is used). Example: possible DBs: ALL,BIO,PUBCHEM,MESH,HMDB,KNAPSACK,CHEBI,PUBMED,KEGG,HSDB,MACONDA,METACYC,GNPS,ZINCBIO,UNDP,YMDB,PLANTCYC,NORMAN,ADDITIONAL,PUBCHEMANNOTATIONBIO,PUBCHEMANNOTATIONDRUG,PUBCHEMANNOTATIONSAFETYANDTOXIC,PUBCHEMANNOTATIONFOOD,KEGGMINE,ECOCYCMINE,YMDBMINE

param.name: candidates
param.label: Number of molecular structure candidates in the output

param.name: db
param.label: Search formulas in the Union of the given databases db-name1,db-name2,db-name3
param.help: If no database is given all possible molecular formulas will be respected (no database is used). Example: possible DBs: ALL,BIO,PUBCHEM,MESH,HMDB,KNAPSACK,CHEBI,PUBMED,KEGG,HSDB,MACONDA,METACYC,GNPS,ZINCBIO,UNDP,YMDB,PLANTCYC,NORMAN,ADDITIONAL,PUBCHEMANNOTATIONBIO,PUBCHEMANNOTATIONDRUG,PUBCHEMANNOTATIONSAFETYANDTOXIC,PUBCHEMANNOTATIONFOOD,KEGGMINE,ECOCYCMINE,YMDBMINE

param.label: Unit of the ambiguity_resolution_mz_tolerance
Tolerance window for precursor selection (Annotation of precursor mz and intensity)
Unit of the precursor_mz_tolerance_annotation
Minimal m/z of a fragment ion choosen as a transition
Maximal m/z of a fragment ion choosen as a transition
Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Assay library generation from DDA data (Metabolomics)
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.8.0/html/UTILS_AssayGeneratorMetabo.html
